page.title: 02HISTORY
page.content: {Biggar}is a place of great Historical interest.The name {Biggar}is thought to mean "soft land",which is an ideal description of the neighbourhood.Finds made in the area show that Man has been here since the Middle Stone Age (4,500 B.C).Overlooking {Biggar }is {Bizzberry},the site of an Iron Age fort.In Roman times a road ran through {Biggar}. {Biggar }became an important place in the Middle Ages with the arrival of the {Fleming }family in the reign of Malcolm 4th (1153-65). The Flemings built an earth work castle,which was replaced c.1400 by astone castle outside {Biggar} called{ {Boghall},there are some ruins still left.{Biggar }has an interesting Mediaeval church called St Mary's,which was the last Mediaeval church to be built in Scotland.
